alert.note: Alert for Knox; Marshall; Peoria; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 10:17PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Marshall, Peoria and Stark. In west central Illinois, Knox. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1015 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - The showers and thunderstorms have moved out of the area. Minor flooding is possible due to runoff from heavy rains earlier this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Galesburg, Chillicothe, Abingdon, Knoxville, Princeville, Dunlap, Brimfield, Williamsfield, West Jersey, Maquon, Laura, Elmore, Gilson, East Galesburg, Duncan, Monica, Dahinda, Lawn Ridge, Delong and Galesburg Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
